tips.title: Quick File Navigation
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+P` to quickly search and open files in your workspace. Start typing the filename to filter the list.

tips.title: Command Palette
tips.content: Access all VS Code commands with `Ctrl+Shift+P` (Windows/Linux) or `Cmd+Shift+P` (macOS). This is your gateway to everything VS Code can do!

tips.title: Multi-Cursor Editing
tips.content: Hold `Alt` (`Option` on macOS) and click to add multiple cursors. Edit multiple lines simultaneously!

tips.title: Zen Mode
tips.content: Toggle distraction-free coding with `Ctrl+K Z`. Press `Esc` twice to exit.

tips.title: Integrated Terminal
tips.content: Toggle the integrated terminal with `` Ctrl+` `` (backtick). Keep coding and running commands without switching windows.

tips.title: Smart Selection
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+D` to select the next occurrence of the current selection. Great for renaming variables or making multiple similar changes!

tips.title: Split Editor Views
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+\` to split the editor into multiple panes. Perfect for viewing different parts of the same file or comparing files side by side.

tips.title: Search Across Files
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+F` to search across all files in your workspace. Perfect for finding specific code or text patterns.

tips.title: Quick File Creation
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+N` for a new untitled file. Add multiple files quickly without leaving your keyboard.

tips.title: IntelliSense Everywhere
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Space` anywhere to manually trigger IntelliSense suggestions. Works in code, settings, and even JSON files!

tips.title: Breadcrumbs Navigation
tips.content: Click the breadcrumbs above the editor or press `Ctrl+Shift+.` to quickly navigate through your file's structure.

tips.title: Quick Fix and Actions
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+.` when you see a lightbulb ðŸ’¡ to view quick fixes and refactoring options.

tips.title: Navigate Back and Forward
tips.content: Use `Alt+Left` and `Alt+Right` to navigate back and forward through your cursor positions.

tips.title: Toggle Line Comment
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+/` to toggle line comments. Works with multiple lines selected too!

tips.title: Move Lines Up/Down
tips.content: Use `Alt+Up` or `Alt+Down` to move lines up or down. Great for reorganizing code quickly!

tips.title: Format Document
tips.content: Press `Shift+Alt+F` to format your entire document. Keep your code clean and consistent!

tips.title: Minimap Navigation
tips.content: Use the minimap on the right side of the editor for quick scrolling through large files. Toggle it with `Ctrl+Shift+P` and search for 'Toggle Minimap'.

tips.title: Go to Definition
tips.content: Press `F12` to jump to the definition of a symbol. Hold `Ctrl` and hover over code to peek at definitions!

tips.title: Find All References
tips.content: Press `Shift+Alt+F12` to find all references to the current symbol. Great for understanding how code is used across your project.

tips.title: Rename Symbol
tips.content: Press `F2` to rename a symbol and automatically update all references throughout your code.

tips.title: Problems Panel
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+M` to toggle the Problems panel and see all errors and warnings in your workspace.

tips.title: Quick Open Previous File
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Tab` to quickly switch between recently used files. Hold `Ctrl` to see more options!

tips.title: Toggle Word Wrap
tips.content: Press `Alt+Z` to toggle word wrap. No more horizontal scrolling for long lines!

tips.title: Fold/Unfold Code
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+Shift+[` and `Ctrl+Shift+]` to fold and unfold code blocks. Keep your editor tidy!

tips.title: Side by Side Editing
tips.content: Drag and drop a file tab to the side of the editor to open it side by side. Perfect for comparing or referencing code!

tips.title: Column Selection
tips.content: Hold `Shift+Alt` while dragging the mouse to select text in columns. Perfect for editing structured text or tables!

tips.title: Navigate File History
tips.content: Use `Alt+Left` and `Alt+Right` to navigate through your file navigation history, just like a web browser!

tips.title: Quick Parameter Hints
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+Space` to see parameter hints for functions. Great for remembering function arguments!

tips.title: Color Theme Switching
tips.content: Quickly switch color themes with `Ctrl+K Ctrl+T`. Try different themes to find your perfect coding environment!

tips.title: Duplicate Line
tips.content: Press `Shift+Alt+Up` or `Shift+Alt+Down` to copy lines up or down. No need to copy and paste!

tips.title: Join Lines
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+J` to join multiple lines into one. Select multiple lines first to join them all!

tips.title: Toggle Activity Bar
tips.content: Save screen space by toggling the Activity Bar with `Ctrl+B`. Get back that precious horizontal space!

tips.title: IntelliSense Tab Completion
tips.content: After invoking IntelliSense, use `Tab` instead of `Enter` to complete the suggestion and replace the word at the cursor.

tips.title: Peek References
tips.content: Use `Shift+F12` to peek references without leaving your current location. Click 'Open to the Side' to see full details!

tips.title: Clear Terminal
tips.content: Clear the integrated terminal with `Ctrl+K` in the terminal (or type 'clear'). Keep your workspace tidy!

tips.title: Save All
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K S` to save all open files at once. Never forget to save your changes!

tips.title: Find by Symbol
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+Shift+O` to quickly navigate to symbols (functions, classes, etc.) within the current file.

tips.title: Workspace Symbol Search
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+T` to search for symbols across your entire workspace. Find any function or class instantly!

tips.title: Toggle Line Numbers
tips.content: Toggle line numbers on/off with `Ctrl+Shift+P`, then type 'Toggle Line Numbers'. Useful for presentations!

tips.title: Auto Save
tips.content: Enable Auto Save via File > Auto Save or set `files.autoSave` to 'afterDelay' in settings. Never lose changes again!

tips.title: Keyboard Reference
tips.content: Press `Ctrl+K Ctrl+R` to open the keyboard shortcuts reference PDF. Great for learning new shortcuts!

tips.title: Indent/Outdent Lines
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+]` to indent and `Ctrl+[` to outdent lines. Works with multiple lines selected!

tips.title: Terminal Split
tips.content: Split the integrated terminal with the + button in the terminal title bar or use the 'Split Terminal' command.

tips.title: Trim Trailing Whitespace
tips.content: Use `Ctrl+K Ctrl+X` to trim trailing whitespace. Keep your code clean automatically!
